skill.name: Code Quality Skill
skill.description: Code quality validation, formatting, linting, and pre-commit checks.
skill.summary: Code quality validation, formatting, linting, and pre-commit checks.
skill.author: ByronWilliamsCPA

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only a SKILL.md markdown file. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, and no environment variable access. The skill provides documentation for standard Python development tools like Black, Ruff, and BasedPyright.

content.value_statement: Manual code quality checks are time-consuming and inconsistent. This skill automates Python code formatting with Black, linting with Ruff, and type checking with BasedPyright to ensure consistent, maintainable code across your projects.
actual_capabilities: Format Python code using Black and Ruff
Run linting checks with Ruff and apply fixes
Perform type checking with BasedPyright strict mode
limitations: Does not auto-fix all linting issues automatically
Requires UV package manager and Python development environment
Does not modify code files without user approval
Rules are project-specific and may require configuration

use_cases.title: Enforce Code Standards
use_cases.description: Apply consistent formatting and linting rules across Python codebases with Black, Ruff, and type checking.

use_cases.title: Pre-commit Validation
use_cases.description: Run pre-commit hooks to catch quality issues before code is committed to version control.

use_cases.title: Automated Quality Checks
use_cases.description: Quickly validate code quality during reviews using standardized Python linting and formatting tools.

prompt_templates.title: Format Code
prompt_templates.prompt: Format all Python files in the project using Black and Ruff format

prompt_templates.title: Lint and Fix
prompt_templates.prompt: Run Ruff linting checks and apply automatic fixes where possible

prompt_templates.title: Type Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Run BasedPyright type checking in strict mode on the source directory

prompt_templates.title: Pre-commit Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Run all pre-commit hooks on all files in the repository

output_examples.input: Run ruff linting and format code
output: Formatting: Running Black on all Python files
Formatting: Running Ruff format for consistency
Linting: Checking with Ruff for code quality issues
Linting: Applying automatic fixes where safe
Results: Summary of any remaining issues requiring manual attention

best_practices: Run quality checks before every commit to catch issues early
Configure Ruff rules in pyproject.toml to match project standards
Use BasedPyright strict mode to catch type-related bugs at development time
anti_patterns: Skipping linting checks because they seem too strict
Ignoring type checking errors without investigation
Adding blanket ignores instead of fixing underlying issues

faq.question: Which Python tools are supported?
faq.answer: Black for formatting, Ruff for linting, BasedPyright for type checking, and pre-commit hooks.

faq.question: What is the line length setting?
faq.answer: This skill uses 88 characters, which is the Black default for Python code.

faq.question: Does it modify files automatically?
faq.answer: Ruff can auto-fix some issues, but all changes require user approval before being applied.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a read-only documentation skill that describes how to run standard linting tools.

faq.question: Why are some rules skipped in tests?
faq.answer: Tests and scripts have relaxed rules for pragmatic development and test flexibility.

faq.question: How is this different from pre-commit CI?
faq.answer: This skill runs quality checks locally before commits, catching issues earlier in development.
